data.title: Baraka (1992)
data.shortSummary: A wordless documentary photographing life across the world

data.title: Farha (2021)
data.shortSummary: A brutal coming-of-age film set at the start of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict

data.title: The Piano Teacher (2001)
data.shortSummary: An unnerving Austrian psychosexual drama from the meticulous auteur Michael Haneke

data.title: Orlando (1992)
data.shortSummary: A queer magic realist period drama based on the feminist classic

data.title: Martin Eden (2019)
data.shortSummary: A vivid and nostalgic adaptation of the 1909 novel, now set in Naples

data.title: Holy Spider (2022)
data.shortSummary: A timely and terrifying noir that takes on systemic abuse and corruption in Iran

data.title: An Elephant Sitting Still (2018)
data.shortSummary: A demanding exercise in despair, and an honest statement from a filmmaker gone too soon

data.title: 76 Days (2020)
data.shortSummary: An urgent plea for empathy told through the initial, frantic outbreak of COVID in Wuhan

data.title: Tár (2022)
data.shortSummary: A haunting and cerebral character study with an undeniable performance by Cate Blanchett

data.title: Bones and All (2022)
data.shortSummary: A classic coming-of-age film with a bloody twist

data.title: The Velvet Underground (2021)
data.shortSummary: Much like the music pioneered by the band, this documentary is experimental, artful, and a bliss to experience

data.title: The Kings of the World (2022)
data.shortSummary: A knife-sharp account of five kids' journey to land restitution and self-determination

data.title: Dogtooth (2009)
data.shortSummary: The cat is the most feared animal there is!

data.title: Procession (2021)
data.shortSummary: A one-of-a-kind documentary that affirms the healing power of community and art

data.title: Happening (2021)
data.shortSummary: Set nearly 60 years ago, this realistically harrowing abortion drama still rings true today

data.title: The Banshees of Inisherin (2022)
data.shortSummary: A chilling Irish tragicomedy from the director of In Bruges

data.title: Vortex (2021)
data.shortSummary: A haunting ode to love, death, and everything in between

data.title: All Quiet on the Western Front (2022)
data.shortSummary: A stunning and sobering World War I drama from Germany

data.title: Clean, Shaven (1993)
data.shortSummary: A schizophrenic man’s parental capability is put to test amidst a murder investigation

data.title: The Innocents (2021)
data.shortSummary: Blending elements of fantasy and horror, this Scandinavian thriller is sure to unnerve the bravest of viewers

data.title: Norte, the End of History (2014)
data.shortSummary: An epic Filipino take on Crime and Punishment that's as harrowing as it is poetic

data.title: Stutz (2022)
data.shortSummary: An impressive experiment that doubles as a loving tribute and an actually helpful guide on how to be a better person

data.title: Pieces of a Woman (2020)
data.shortSummary: An unnerving but honest look at childbirth, partnership, and grief

data.title: Sound of Metal (2020)
data.shortSummary: Riz Ahmed excels in this piercing drama about a musician losing his hearing.

data.title: The Nightingale (2018)
data.shortSummary: An unsettling but important social horror from the director of The Babadook

data.title: Control Room (2004)
data.shortSummary: By closely following the media coverage of the Iraq war on both sides, Control Room serves as the ultimate proof that objectivity is a myth

data.title: To Leslie (2022)
data.shortSummary: A humane portrait of poverty and addiction

data.title: Amores Perros (2000)
data.shortSummary: Love, betrayal, and death await three characters in this uncompromising, layered drama

data.title: Playground (2021)
data.shortSummary: An unfiltered account of the darker side of childhood

data.title: Quo Vadis Aida? (2020)
data.shortSummary: A difficult and alarmingly timely portrayal of the Srebrenica massacre

data.title: Poetry (2011)
data.shortSummary: A movie that aims straight for your heart and leaves you broken into a thousand pieces

data.title: Brazil (1985)
data.shortSummary: A grand journey where reality and fantasy collide

data.title: Great Freedom (2021)
data.shortSummary: Love perseveres in this subtle but compelling drama

data.title: One Cut of the Dead (2017)
data.shortSummary: A one-of-a-kind Japanese zombie comedy that takes the genre to another dimension

data.title: The Platform (2019)
data.shortSummary: If Parasite was too tame for you

data.title: Saint Omer (2022)
data.shortSummary: The complexities of humanity are tackled in this profound, poetic, and immensely powerful French film

data.title: Tell Me Who I Am (2019)
data.shortSummary: A devastating, unlikely story

data.title: Wendy and Lucy (2008)
data.shortSummary: Michelle Williams gives her all as a drifter just trying to make it in America

data.title: Short Term 12 (2013)
data.shortSummary: Sweet, slow-moving, and possibly life-changing, this American drama shines the light on the chaos and crises of social work in America

data.title: Midsommar (2019)
data.shortSummary: A horror film that might be too twisted for anyone to enjoy

data.title: The Tragedy of Macbeth (2021)
data.shortSummary: A glorious visual spectacle that takes a uniquely realistic, cerebral take on Shakespeare

data.title: Waltz with Bashir (2008)
data.shortSummary: An unflinching film that blends genre and form to effectively deliver its anti-war message

data.title: Syndromes and a Century (2006)
data.shortSummary: A gentle meditation on human experience set in two hospitals

data.title: The Body Remembers When The World Broke Open (2019)
data.shortSummary: Brilliantly and painfully realistic

data.title: The Hate U Give (2018)
data.shortSummary: A powerful 'movie' movie

data.title: Shattered Glass (2003)
data.shortSummary: An incisive look at the rise and fall of a celebrated journalist

data.title: Mommy (2014)
data.shortSummary: Aiming straight for the heart while punching you in the guts, Mommy is a crazy chamber piece about a widowed mother and her next-door neighbor bringing up a savage teenager

data.title: The Woman Who Left (2016)
data.shortSummary: A Golden Lion-winning moralistic tale from slow cinema master Lav Diaz

data.title: Never Rarely Sometimes Always (2020)
data.shortSummary: A painfully realistic journey of unplanned teenage pregnancy

data.title: Vagabond (1985)
data.shortSummary: In a series of flashbacks, this drama traces the final steps of a transient woman on her uncharted journey across the French countryside to her lonely end

data.title: Elle (2016)
data.shortSummary: An always-excellent Isabelle Huppert powers this thrilling French revenge film

data.title: Mass (2021)
data.shortSummary: A microscopic and unrelenting look at grief and healing

data.title: Cure (1997)
data.shortSummary: A series of mysterious murders leads a detective to a former psychological student

data.title: A Cop Movie (2021)
data.shortSummary: An empathetic and impressively inventive look at the notoriously corrupt Mexican police force

data.title: School Life (2016)
data.shortSummary: A compassionate year-in-the-life documentary about two seasoned teachers nearing retirement at an Irish boarding school

data.title: Mississippi Damned (2009)
data.shortSummary: Following a legacy of trauma in rural Mississippi

data.title: Manchester by the Sea (2016)
data.shortSummary: Kenneth Lonergan's third film is honest, strange, and affecting drama.

data.title: The Intouchables (2012)
data.shortSummary: An all-arounder French comedy-drama based on a true story

data.title: A Better Life (2011)
data.shortSummary: The illegal immigrant experience, portrayed with heart

data.title: The Endless Trench (2019)
data.shortSummary: A cathartic meditation on isolation
Cancer comedy that is funny, surprisingly subtle, and not afraid of “going there”.

data.title: Blue Valentine (2010)
data.shortSummary: A meditative but devastating account of a decaying marriage

data.title: The Look of Silence (2015)
data.shortSummary: A devastating documentary on reconciliation in the shadow of the Indonesian Genocide.

data.title: Utøya: July 22 (2019)
data.shortSummary: An Excruciatingly Realistic Account of A Terrorist Attack

data.title: 4 Months, 3 Weeks and 2 Days (2007)
data.shortSummary: A suspenseful and horrible drama from Romania, winner of a Palme d'Or

data.title: Heavenly Creatures (1994)
data.shortSummary: Kate Winslet's feature debut in Peter Jackson's hallucinatory world

data.title: A Separation (2011)
data.shortSummary: Iranian star director Asghar Farhadi’s delicate drama deals with the complexity of human morals and serves as a perfect introduction to the rich film culture of Iran

data.title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower (2012)
The Diving Bell and the Butterfly (2007)
data.shortSummary: If this visually breath-taking and heart-wrenching film doesn't make you cry, nothing will.

data.title: Mr. Nobody (2009)
data.shortSummary: This ambitious sci-fi romance with Jared Leto has become an indie cult classic.

data.title: Blackfish (2013)
data.shortSummary: A revelatory documentary on the treatment of Orcas that is gripping like a thriller.

data.title: Samsara (2012)
data.shortSummary: Quite literally a no-words documentary on the ever-turning wheel of life.

data.title: Departures (Okuribito) (2008)
data.shortSummary: An elegant and sentimental film about a reluctant cellist becoming a mortician.

data.title: Gook (2017)
data.shortSummary: This stylish black-and-white drama weaves a rich tapestry of emotions.

data.title: The Skeleton Twins (2014)
data.shortSummary: Two unlikely leads star in this bleak comedy-drama about two estranged twins coming back together.

headline: Popular + Challenging
subtitle: Find the best challenging movies to watch, from our mood category. Like everything on agoodmovietowatch, these challenging movies are highly-rated by both viewers and critics.
